intro: Oenothera comosa, commonly known as the silky evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy stems and showy yellow flowers that open in the evening. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in dry, open habitats. Oenothera comosa is a member of the Onagraceae family, which includes other evening primroses and related species.
